channel.title: Comments on: SSRS Nugget: displaying placeholders when no rows are returned
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description:
Hi George,
thanks for your contribution. It was considered though, as I stated in the introduction. However the guy who asked the question explicitly mentioned he did not want the NoRowMessage, hence the alternative presented in this piece.
item.content:encoded:
Hi George,

thanks for your contribution. It was considered though, as I stated in the introduction. However the guy who asked the question explicitly mentioned he did not want the NoRowMessage, hence the alternative presented in this piece.

item.title: By: George Squillace
item.dc:creator: George Squillace
item.description: Here is another solution in case it wasn't already considered, the use of the "NoRowMessage" property found here, http://fendy-huang.blogspot.com/2011/06/how-to-display-no-row-information-on.html.
item.content:encoded: Here is another solution in case it wasn’t already considered, the use of the “NoRowMessage” property found here, http://fendy-huang.blogspot.com/2011/06/how-to-display-no-row-information-on.html.

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description:
Hi Hugo,
thanks for reading. Your solution is indeed a good alternative and is easier to use. If you have no control over the source query (for example you are given a stored procedure), then the method explained in this post still works.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Hugo,

thanks for reading.
Your solution is indeed a good alternative and is easier to use.
If you have no control over the source query (for example you are given a stored procedure), then the method explained in this post still works.

item.title: By: Sugo S
item.dc:creator: Sugo S
item.description:
have you tried the "If not exist"... here goes an example... IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT ProductCategoryAlternateKey,EnglishProductCategoryName FROM DimProductCategory;) begin Select 'none' as ProductCategoryAlternateKey,'none' as EnglishProductCategoryName end
what it does is that it evaluates your query, if it return records then no problem, if it does not bring any, then it just runs the query with the "none" result....
regards Hugo
item.content:encoded:
have you tried the “If not exist”…
here goes an example…
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT ProductCategoryAlternateKey,EnglishProductCategoryName
FROM DimProductCategory;)
begin
Select ‘none’ as ProductCategoryAlternateKey,’none’ as EnglishProductCategoryName
end

what it does is that it evaluates your query, if it return records then no problem, if it does not bring any, then it just runs the query with the “none” result….

regards Hugo
